p: Zika virus (ZIKV) is a member of the family Flaviviridae and the genus Flavivirus; it was originally isolated in 1947 from a febrile sentinel rhesus monkey in the Zika forest (Uganda). 1 In 2015, the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the Zika epidemic a public health emergency in Brazil owing to the outbreak and exponential growth of reported cases of microcephaly and other congenital defects. 1, 2
